newsitem.title: FRANCE: Details of new MATIF white sugar futures contract.
newsitem.headline: Details of new MATIF white sugar futures contract.

text.p: MATIF SA issued the following contract details for its new white futures contract with an Icumsa rating of 100, scheduled to begin trading on June 20.
White beet or cane sugar of all origins, dry, of regular grain size, free-flowing, of sound fair and market quality meeting the following criteria:
The delivered sugar must be produced in the country of the delivery port, except for European Union ports where sugar can come from any origin within the Union.
Seven successive delivery months are traded from among March, May, August, October, December.
15 calendar days before the first calendar day of the month of delivery. If this day is a non-working day, the last trading day is the previous trading day.
First business day following the last trading day of a delivery month.
Physical delivery of the lot in FOB position, stowed and customs cleared between the first day of the month of delivery and the last day of the following month.
Delivery ports appear in a separate list drawn by MATIF SA.
The notification form, submitted by the seller to the Clearing House, must be relative to a minimum quantity of 5,000 tonnes net.
Polypropylene bags, white or brown only, lined with an inner bag or film of food grade polyethylene, of a minimum weight of both polypropylene and polyethylene of 140 grams.
